oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Möglichkeiten und Grenzen der Unkrautreduzierung durch Untersaaten in Mais
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jung, Rüdiger
Rauber, Rolf
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Root crops
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cultivation of maize is more demanding in organic than conventional farming. However, an increasing interest in this cultivation is noticeable. Weed regrowth is a key problem in organic maize cultivation. Therefore, an agronomy subproject of the main project ‘Breeding of maize cultivars for Organic Farming' aims at identifying a combination of maize genotype and undersown crop, which is highly effective in terms of weed suppression and maize grain yield.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Jung, Rüdiger and Rauber, Rolf (2013) Möglichkeiten und Grenzen der Unkrautreduzierung durch Untersaaten in Mais. Paper at: 12. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Rheinische Friedrich-Wilhelms-Universität, Bonn, 5. bis 8. März 2013.
